newsitem.title: USA: N.Y. Times names other top editors.
newsitem.headline: N.Y. Times names other top editors.

text.p: New York Times Co said Friday it reshuffled more top editors at its Times newspaper.
The company said Andrew Rosenthal, the paper's Washington editor, was named foreign editor, and Michael Oreskes, the paper's metropolitan editor, was named Washington bureau chief.
R.W. Apple, who has been Washington bureau chief, was named the paper's chief correspondent.
Joyce Purnick, the deputy metro editor, was named metropolitan editor.
Joseph Lelyveld, the executive editor, said the editors would assume their new posts over the next few months.
Rosenthal, the son of former executive editor A.M. Rosenthal, replaces Bill Keller, who was named managing editor on Thursday.

The changes were also contained in a memo from Lelyveld to staff members on Friday. "Here's another exercise in rumor confirmation," Lelyveld wrote, "with my abject apologies again, for having allowed myself to get beaten on this story."
